trans-unit.source: Node.js debugging support
Node.js v6.3+ via Inspector Protocol
Use JavaScript source maps (if they exist).
Attribute 'outDir' is deprecated, use 'outFiles' instead.

If source maps are enabled, these glob patterns specify the generated JavaScript files. If a pattern starts with `!` the files are excluded. If not specified, the generated code is expected in the same directory as its source.
Automatically stop program after launch.
Debug port to attach to. Default is 9229.
TCP/IP address of debug port. Default is 'localhost'.
Retry for this number of milliseconds to connect to Node.js. Default is 10000 ms.
Automatically step through generated code that cannot be mapped back to the original source.
When sourcemaps are downloaded from a URL, cache them to disk.
When true, the adapter logs its own diagnostic info to the console
'diagnosticLogging' is deprecated. Use 'trace' instead.
When true, the adapter logs all traffic with the client and target (as well as the info logged by 'diagnosticLogging')
'verboseDiagnosticLogging' is deprecated. Use 'trace' instead.
When 'true', the debugger will log tracing info to a file. When 'verbose', it will also show logs in the console.
A set of mappings for rewriting the locations of source files from what the sourcemap says, to their locations on disk. See README for details.
An array of file or folder names, or glob patterns, to skip when debugging.
Restart session after Node.js has terminated.
Show the async calls that led to the current call stack.
Don't set breakpoints in any file until a sourcemap has been loaded for that file.
Absolute path to the program.
Where to launch the debug target: internal console, integrated terminal, or external terminal.
Command line arguments passed to the program.
Absolute path to the working directory of the program being debugged.
Runtime to use. Either an absolute path or the name of a runtime available on the PATH. If ommitted `node` is assumed.
Optional arguments passed to the runtime executable.
Environment variables passed to the program. The value `null` removes the variable from the environment.
Absolute path to a file containing environment variable definitions.
From where to capture output messages: The debug API, or stdout/stderr streams.
Launch
ID of process to attach to.
The local source root that corresponds to the 'remoteRoot'.
The source root of the remote host.
Attach
Attach to Process
Toggle Skipping this File
VS Code Extension Development
Absolute path to VS Code.
Automatically stop the extension host after launch.
Environment variables passed to the extension host.
VS Code Extension Development
Launch a VS Code extension in debug mode
Launch Extension
Cannot find runtime '{0}' on PATH. Is '{0}' installed?
Cannot launch debug target in terminal ({0}).
Cannot launch debug target ({0}).
Cannot debug extension ({0}).
Unknown console type '{0}'.
Cannot launch program '{0}'; configuring source maps might help.
Cannot launch program '{0}'; setting the '{1}' attribute might help.
Cannot launch program '{0}' because corresponding JavaScript cannot be found.
Can't load environment variables from file ({0}).
Cannot find Windows Subsystem for Linux installation.
Program path uses differently cased character as file on disk; this might result in breakpoints not being hit.
Node Debug Console
Attribute '{0}' does not exist ('{1}').
Attribute '{0}' is not absolute ('{1}'); consider adding '{2}' as a prefix to make it absolute.
Cannot find runtime '{0}' on PATH. Make sure to have '{0}' installed.
More Information
